Protecting Washington’s retail jobs and their employers

From the largest national chains to the smallest independent businesses, we are the primary advocacy group for retailers of all shapes and sizes across the State of Washington. Nearly 400,000 people work for retailers across the state. Our mission is to protect those jobs and the employers who provide them.

Join Us » Learn About Us »

Our Top 3 Issues

The City Council should defeat the latest in a series of failed corporate payroll tax proposals, the latest on Seattle employees making at least $150,000 a year. It is bad…Continue Reading

In recovering from record-breaking unemployment claims caused by the coronavirus and improper payments for fraudulent claims, Employment Security should not charge employers through their unemployment taxes to recover funds. State…Continue Reading

Reasons to Become a Member

News

Link to our news page where you will find up-to date news relevant to each business in Washington State no matter how large or small.

Advocacy

Retailers representing all categories and sizes recognize the value of combining resources and ideas knowing that a strong association could achieve goals no single business could accomplish individually.

Learn More »

Initiatives

As issues evolve, Washington Retail goes beyond its core mission with targeted initiatives to help our valuable membership.

Learn More »

Retail Services

When enrolled in the Group Retrospective (RETRO) Rating Program companies can enjoy lower workers’ compensation premiums due to the aggressive on-site claims management system.  We offer a robust safety program along with administering Labor & Industries Return-to-Work program.  The caveat being the opportunity to earn back a portion of what you pay in workers’ compensation premiums in the form of a refund.

Learn More »

Featured

Creating Digital Strategies That Convert: An Intro to Omni-Channel Retailing for Independent Retailers

Webinar: July 28th (Tues) 10:00AM PT 60 minutes

Presented by: Julia Lara, Retail Entrepreneur and Certified Business Advisor WA Small Business Development Center

Retailing isn’t what it used to be…as we emerge from the recent disruptions, it has never been more critical for independent retailers to embrace digital strategies and multi-platform strategies. You do not have to be a digital native or spend heavily to put some of these strategies into action. Join us for this interactive webinar on creating digital content that will help you convert your audience into paying customers, no matter the platform. We will go over practical tips and tricks, case studies, and simple action items you can take right away to help your business thrive.

Reopening and COVID-19 Resources for Retailers

Making safety planning a priority to protect your employees and customers is essential to reopening retail businesses during a pandemic. The Retail COVID Safety Operational Plan and In-store Posters will help you prepare for each phase of your reopening.

When the entire retail sector is prepared to meet this challenge by giving consumers the assurance that reopening our economy is gradual and well-thought out, customers will come back with confidence.

Retail Services

Retail Services a subsidiary of Washington Retail is a value-based organization that customizes all services to fit our members needs and requirements. We are the liaison between you and Labor & Industries in the State of Washington.

Visit Retail Services »

WR is a non-profit trade group that provides political strength to bring about change. Partner with an assocation that understands not only your industry, but your unique individual business requirements in Washington State.

Membership Requirements »

The Group Retrospective Rating Program (RETRO) is a safety incentive program. The program was developed to encourage safety in the workplace and drive down the costs of doing business in Washington State.

Learn More About Retro »
